page.title: 07LEISURE IN LANGPORT
page.content: We are 7 and 8 years old and we asked our class to find out what their mums and dads did in Langport in their spare time. We found out that some of them went to Clubs each week or belonged to a team, while some went out on their own. Here is a list of the activities. Women's Institute; angling; tennis, badminton, football, cricket; snooker; gardening; rambling; popmobility; tap dancing, ballroom dancing; eating out; going to a pub for a drink, a meal, to play darts, skittles or pool; attending evening classes at the Comprehensive School to learn new skills, for pleasure or to improve their education with classes linked to exams. Many adults are happy to stay at home with their families and do not use the facilities in the town.
